column4: Guys i have finish install ubuntu server 11.10, but there is no GUI just console
correct, the server install does not come with a gui
1.) why did you use the server install 2.) what sort of gui are you looking for
i used the server for the development project,, there is some programmer will subit the code
you know you could use the desktop install just fine
that comes with a gui and tools installed by default
is that an option for you ?
you can also install a gui on the server install, what sort of thing where you looking for
ok, what sort of gui are you looking for ?
if you give us an idea of what gui you want / need / expected we can help you install it
or if you tell us the goal you have of using the gui, we can also advise you
thats fine, is there a specific gui you want / had in mine
that really doesn't effect anything
ok, so you want gnome,
what version of ubuntu is this

ok - if you use the command "sudo apt-get ubuntu-desktop" that will install gnome with the unity shell (like the ubuntu desktop) there are other options that may be better suited to the server like the "lubuntu-desktop" package
https://help.ubuntu.com/11.10/serverguide/C/network-configuration.html
that document will guide you
he's fine here
read the link I gave you
https://help.ubuntu.com/11.10/serverguide/C/network-configuration.html
it will walk you through it
just follow the guide https://help.ubuntu.com/11.10/serverguide/C/network-configuration.html
